comment: Controller code looks fine in that article. As for the routes, that looks a little dated. You can use the same resources routing you had before, but you may want to point them at a common controller, depending

Run rake routes to see the routes available to you. You could try polymorphic_path, not sure if that will help you depending on your situation. There's also this question about polymorphic associations and routes. Questions more specific like this may be better off as a whole new StackOverflow question.

Controller code looks fine in that article. As for the routes, that looks a little dated. You can use the same resources routing you had before, but you may want to point them at a common controller, depending
For my comments table, should I remove post_id and book_id and add commentable_id:integer commentable_type:string ?
